greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of 1/(1 - Sum_{k>=1} q(k)*x^k), where q(k) = number of partitions of k into distinct parts (A000009).
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..2816
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Partition Function Q
Index entries for sequences related to partitions
Index entries for sequences related to compositions
mathematica: nmax = 32; CoefficientList[Series[1/(1 - Sum[PartitionsQ[k] x^k, {k, 1, nmax}]), {x, 0, nmax}], x]
nmax = 32; CoefficientList[Series[1/(2 - Product[1 + x^k, {k, 1, nmax}]), {x, 0, nmax}], x]
a[0] = 1; a[n_] := a[n] = Sum[PartitionsQ[k] a[n - k], {k, 1, n}]; Table[a[n], {n, 0, 32}]
results.author: _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, May 22 2018
